If they exist on your hard drive, the game will not boot up.This is a documented problem with many users and one that EA has flat-out refused to fix. This is because EA are swindlers and thieves. Do not purchase this game.

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2014
												As much as I want to like this game...I can't. I love the Burnout series. But there are so many problems with this one. First off is the multiplayer...that's completely down so you can't get anything. Second is the graphics, while some people think they look good I find them not to be...the pictures you see make the game look prettier than it really is. Third is the mechanics. Drifting is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥because once you go into a drift it's hard to get out. The flow doesn't feel as smooth as it does in the other Burnout games and turning corners is more irritating than fun. Not only that but the physics don't feel realistic enough either. The "DJ" of this game gets VERY annoying very quickly and there's no way to turn off his repetitive comments of how you can win. The races are literally just point A to point B. At most you make maybe one or two turns in a race and you can get to the finish line. Sure you can take shortcuts along the way...but the shortcuts also feel too repetitive and conveniently placed. I also feel like the cars in this game are a joke. And while I appreciate almost all types of music....all there is is rock and alternative. There's really no real different genres. Personally I find this game sad. 5/10 -Frillin

number of helpful: 8 of 21 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2016
												Mildly entertaining racing game that gets old really fast.For a 2009 game the graphics still hold up fairly well, and it performs smoothly at 1920x1080 resolution. It's fun to race and take down opponent cars by slamming them into obstacles, but the experience grows stale too quickly.The environment is limited to one city so you'll see the same roads and scenery over and over again. The cars all handle pretty similarly so there's not much variety there, either.Where things get really frustrating is the user friendliness. The game doesn't do a very good job of showing where to go, so you can easily get lost while trying to race ahead of your opponents. Who wants to constantly be looking at the map while driving? It's easy to lose races because of this, and when it happens there's no way to quickly retry. You have to drive all the way back to the beginning, which can sometimes take a good 5 minutes. Given how repetitive this experience is, the game feels torturous and you feel like you are getting punished for not memorizing the city's layout.There are cars that you can't unlock because the online servers are dead forever, so they're just there to tease you.There's really not much here to recommend, to be honest.

number of helpful: 7 of 19 people (37%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												Oh boy, let me just start this "review" (If we can call it that) by warning you to stay away from the PC version of Burnout Paradise!No, not because of its gameplay and/or visual quality (I owned this bad boy a few years ago on the X360 and it was indeed a fun ride), but because this game is the absolute definition of garbage on the PC!...and why is that you might ask?Well, where do I start?First off, I cannot for the life of me start this game up by conventional means without it crashing instantly, and trust me, I'm not the only one experiencing similar problems, browse it on the internet if you must. ...but of course, such could be fixed easily, just give the game a try in "compatibility mode", and you should be good to go right? Wrong!Running this bastar♥ in compatibility mode for "Windows XP Service Pack 3" (the recommended) or even going as far as adventuring your self in the ancient ruins of "Windows 95" will in fact boot you up past the start up screen, but good luck playing the game for about 10 or so minutes without it freezing dead on its tracks!On top of it by running it in compatibility mode you can kiss your steam overlay tab good bye.I didn't gave up though, upon some research, I discovered that many other things could cause the game to crash such as programs related to your Webcam, which you obviously shouldn't bother with if you don't have one, that is unless you happen to have "Dxtory" (which is kindda like good old "Fraps") installed, as for some odd reason "Dxtory" appears as a Webcam, and yes even if it's turned off it'll affect the game (I heard "XSplit" might cause the same symptoms as "Dxtory", but I'm not sure), uninstall it and see if it does the trick....but it could maybe even be related to your multi-core CPU, which if so, it could supposedly be fixed by doing as it follows...- Right Click "Burnout Paradise" > Properties > Set Launch Options > (type in) -multithread (and press OK).Of course, such didn't work for me either and sadly, as of now, I can only play the game 10 minutes at a time, on top of that, the game does not support classic "Window Mode", which might not seem like a big deal, but sometimes you might need to do such because reasons...As a final verdict, do NOT waste your greens on the PC version of this game (unless you're still rocking little old Windows XP, wich I think might play Burnout Paradise withouth any problems, but I'm not sure of it), it's simply not worth it, have a good one.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2016
												Nice graphics, and it's open world - you choose your route to the finish line.Unfortunately, the racing itself is terrible. It has the common issue of having reverse/accelerate be the brakes for each other, so you have no dedicated brake key (nor anything that actually functions as brakes would). There are no gear changes (not even automatic gear changes - whaaat), and the steering is beyond oversensitive. It's also a shame that there's no in-seat view when driving - your view is either behind the car, or right in front of it.You'll also have your driving constantly interrupted (literally pausing the race and your progress halfway through) until you get through all of the gaudy tutorial messages, of which there are heaaaaaps. Heaaaaaaaaaps.

												This game looks like it came out of 2004. It has the most unnatural keybinds that I've ever seen. You cannot change these keybinds. (A is accelerate. number of helpful: 5 of 17 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 12, 2014
												It's an open world racer (of sorts) that overcomplicates the racing elements while over simplifying all the customization options.PROS-A fairly large & open world to explore-Collectibles-Lots of different cars-Online ModesCONS-The world is confusing & easy to get lost -Steam Version is incomplete & has DLC cars that can't be obtained-Online Modes have Cheaters-Requiares EA Account Log-InGAMEPLAY & FEATURESI guess you could call this game an open world collectathon with races & challenges as your objectives.  It's a very good concept but some parts weren't really executed properly.  For one, it's hard to figure out where exactly you are in the world & where you need to go in races.  Most racing games have you on a set track but this game all the tracks are connected & if you mess up by making a wrong turn you're pretty much screwed. To actually race you need to memorize the world map for the best routes to take in each race & it's just not worth it for the minimal rewards you get for doing it.  Each race is set up so you drive to the starting point, press a button & start the race.  The problem with this is you have absolutely no idea where you're going or the routes you need to take to get there.  It will take you several tries just to find & win the simplest of tracks because of the huge lack of direction you're given.  The game does try to help you by using the blinker on your car to tell you when there's an upcoming turn at least but it's not nearly enough.  I constantly find myself trying to do races & getting lost during them simply because of how lack of direction there is in this game.The plus side is the Road Rage races, where direction is not really needed.  You just need to take out as many other racers as you can within the time limit while reaching the set goal.  This is probably the best challenge in the game since you don't need to figure out where to go & just drive. There are also things in the world to collect & find such as hidden pathways, cars to take down that add themselves to your collection & bill boards.  I don't know if you actually get anything for doing 100% since I don't care enough about this game to 100% collect everything in it.  Most of what it seemed relatively pointless, honestly, with the exception of the car unlocks.You can customize certain cars but only the type of color & paint job, e.g. Metalic, gloss, etc.  The motorcycles let you pick between Male/Female riders but that's about it. That's really all you can do cuztomization wise.ISSUESThere's also an abundance of cheaters in online modes.  Just recently I had a game with at least two cheaters who were both using cheats that gave them instant take downs & made them immune to take downs.  Basically, this means that whenever they just barely tapped my car or anyone elses we'd be taken down & even if we rammed them through a wall they'd never be taken down.  Their takedown score was around 10x what everyone elses was the entire match.  And trust me, I played with these two long enough to know they were cheating.  I only wish I was recording at the time so I could show all the BS that was going on.There's also a small amount of people who actually play online now.  I played this game for several hours recently & got into about 4 games but each game I was in one of those two cheaters were always in one.  So, in the end I just accepted that I wasn't gonna be playing to win & just ended up goofing off with the hackers for a few hours.  There also is no report system in the game so if someone is cheating you can't do anything about it.  The only thing you can do is try to deal with it or leave the online mode.You also can't get the DLC content through Steam since EA is a bunch of D-bags.  They cut off the EA marketplace so even though you're buying the "Ultimate Box" you're getting an incomplete product.  To make matters worse the online shop will constantly pop up every time you boot up the game, but it will just load a blank white screen.  So, it taunts you saying, "Yea, this game is missing features.  Thanks for buying it, sucker!"  OVERALLOverall, this game isn't bad but it's really not worth anyone's time anymore unless you just want a driving game to goof off with. The online modes have hackers & the whole game takes too long to figure out & memorize.  If you want a real racing experience that doesn't just involve driving around in an open world where you just crash cars you'd be better off trying something else.  If not, then feel free to try this one cause crashing cars & driving around doing random nonsense is the best part about this game.

Posted: July 23, 2014
												Alright so I'm not normally the guy to write Reviews but here we go :I saw this Title for 1,50€ on sale and since I played it countless of hours on my playstation3 I thought might aswell grab it while its practically free (compared to the 1 1/2 burgers you'd get for that money)While downloading this game I watched the reviews for this game. Normally I do that before I buy games but well I knew what I buy here.So my shock was even greater when I checked all the negative reviews while downloading this game, speaking of constant crashes, the most abysmal port they have ever seen etc.Let me tell you this, maybe im one out of a thousand (I don't think so) but so far this game works flawlessly for me. Even better than on console.Many bad reviews were given because apparently the game is crashing on their side because of some webcam issue because the game wants to take a picture of you for your drivers license.. Did these people never open the configuration before starting the game? You can disable the webcam there. BOOM. Done.Also I saw bad reviews because apparently the game didn't pick up the xbox controller. I started the game, took my xbox controller in my hand and rocked through Paradise City.There were also many bad reviews because its an open world racing game and they were saying as how you would get lost and only look at the map while driving.. Yeah, maybe, if you just start the game.. but after years of not playing this game I bought it today on PC, jumped into the game and could still drive like a master through this awesome designed city, I still knew all the shortcuts i basically felt right at home. Just because the game doesn't only give you one simple straight path with no other choices to drive on doesn't make it a bad racing game - it juThere is one bad point about this game. It seems as if the developers dropped the ingame DLC's you can buy. So you can no longer ingame spend your money on other cars (and lets be honest here, you can get about 6 normal cars and idk 15 toy cars which never appealed to me) but i've heard there is a fix for that which just unlocks all the cars without having you to spend anything. ALSO THIS DOES NOT MEAN THAT ONLINE WON'T WORK ANYMORE. As far as I could see all online functions were still working just fine.Yes, its a bit different from Burnout 3 (which is still the best in the series imo) but there is really a LOT of fun to be had here. In some aspects I like it even more than BO3 because of the open world you get to know places and even though no race is like the other after and after you learn the city and later missions aren't just harder because the A.I drives more unfairly but also because it becomes hard to combo all the shortcuts you've learned on the whole map into one good run on a race.I think for 1,50€ it is INSANE value, even for the full price at 6€ I still think its basically stealing from the developers. I played at least 200hours on playstation and I didnt even get into online thaaat far. By the way, Online functions are really great in this game.To be honest I would still be recommending it for 20€. Great game 9/10

content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
												Very disappointing. The game looks good enough, especially with ENB, but that's about all it has going for it. Criterion purport the idea of race events on a free roam map as something new, "unlike any other driving experience", even though Need for Speed Underground 2 and Test Drive Unlimited had both done similar things prior to its release. All events are extremely easy, and with no difficulty option (at least not one I could find in the ill-conceived labyrinthine menu system), the game soon becomes very dull. In-game advertisements are a spit in the face from the developers. Perhaps it would be understandable if the game were free to play, or if it were trying to emulate a "real world", but it's not. These were clearly only put in for profit, not an attempt at realism, since the game is set in a fictional city and none of the cars are licensed. I paid for the game I don't want to see Burger King and EVGA advertisements while playing it. Various elements of the game are at cross-purposes with each other. Events are put at every intersection, supposedly to cut down on monotony and so there's never an event too far away, but the races aren't gated and the route isn't highlighted on the map as with other arcade racers, which means you have to open your map at the beginning of each race and spend time planning your route. You can't jump to events either, which, in the case of Burning Route events, often means you have to drive halfway across the map just to begin a race. On the topic of Burning Route events; the game boasts a range of 75 cars, when in actuality, in terms of unique vehicles there is about half that, with the other half being practically carbon-copies with different paint jobs which are rewarded after completing time trials. By the end of the game, you'll only be using about 3 of the cars anyway (the best in each category; stunt, aggression and speed), since the others are relatively useless. The soundtrack is awful. For reasons unknown to anyone but the developers, there are 3 different styles of music in this game; pop/rock songs, instrumental songs from the three previous Burnout games, and classical compositions. The loudness levels are not normalized either, which means that some songs are barely audible while others are quite loud. The "CrashFM" DJ is obnoxious and detestable.

content:
Posted: June 5, 2016
Product received for free
												If flatout 2 and FUEL have a child, this would be the hideus resultThis is suppose to be a racing game right? well that is what at least try to market, a game with cars that just happen to go fast isn't a racing game. The focus on this game is to get from A to B wrecking every oppponent on your way, like seriously, it doesn't get any better than that. Oh also something important.. traffic > you, you'll be crashing every 5 minutes against either a wall or a traffic car crusing the intersection which it will be EXACTLY where you'll be if you dont change your speed or direction taking you 5 valuble seconds which makes you loose the race. Every time you crash you need to see a 5 seconds animation which you CANT skip. The car is totally unresponsive to start needing 2/3 seconds to be able to start using the boost, same applies if you have being going on reverse and then you need to go forward again. The menu is the worst thing you can imagine, its absolutly and disgustingly crafted, if you want to the options menu you need to go like 3 other menus, everytime you hit the pause button because the "main menu" is just stats of what you found.Also the game doesn't teach you how to stop an unwanted race so I need it to go and join the online servers in order to do so AND JUST WHEN I DO IT THE GAME FINALLY TEACHS ME HOW "If you want to stop a race just stop in the place till its over" oh that would have been great to know like 10 mins before when I was trying to figure something out..There a 3 disciplines of cars: stunt - speed - strenght, everyone represent how they get boost and how it works, stunts you may already figured, strenght by hitting other cars and speed by driving alone, but here's where the desing goes even worst. A game like racing demands fast reactions and tools that you need to know how they work and that you can trust (cars you know how they steer, how they drift and they acceleration) the game totally fails at giving you any of that, there are several cars that feel just horrible and next to impossible to use it in a real scenario (i played "arcady" racing game many years of my life and play with a gamepad so it's not me the problem). The best of all is that the speed cars are only able to use boost when its full, and if you get enough while using it you may still use it but the amount of traffic this game has is ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS so is absolutly unreliable and also its unpractical because you cant get from it what you need when you need itClosing notes: if you want a GOOD open world racing game just go and play any need for speed, from the top of my head "most wanted", "underground 2", "carbon", and just to mention a few. If you want something hard that you will die every five minutes but its actually fun and challenging go for any dark souls.if you specificaly want a racing game where destruction is the focus go with flatout 2 (it even has a derby mode and many other fun games)TL;DR:this ain't a racing game just a derby with the objective of going from A to B with a lot of horribly mechanics for the cars and unhumanly possible amount of traffic that will F*** you up. Also the game isn't challenging at all, the traffic and bad camera is punishing creating this pseudo-hard gameplay

Posted: November 18, 2014
												If you've ever played Burnout 3, then you will know that this game sucks horribly compared to it. Sure, for a generic everyday "me is srs gamR" type of person it might be fun, but having played Burnout 3 for so many years and then try to play this monstorosity is like trying to eat rock after eating cake. I'm guessing that they went like "Oh, you know all these things that made Burnout 3 one of the greatest and most fun racing games ever? Come on Steven, you know what I'm talking about; the aftertouch, the takedowns, the crashes. Yeah all those, let's just remove them and make something that makes our fans cry their tears out".At this point I am literally speechless(hence why I'm typing) at how bad this turned out. I tested it when I bought it from the Humble Bundle, and I tested it today again, but it just didn't work out. At best I give this game 3/10, because it has okay music and the enviroment is pretty nice looking.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2016
												This game is way too simplistic, repetitive and too long for its own good. You don’t feel real progression throughout the game. The driving feels like a dumbed down version of burnout 3, there isn’t really any challenge in the races themselves and the cars all feel and handle the same. What ultimately kills this game for me is the lack of variety in the activities you are doing. You are doing the same sh*t throughout the same areas of the open world map hundreds of times. Here are some ways to prevent a racing game from feeling repetitive. 1.	Feeling real progression as you are playing e.g. NFS Most Wanted 20052.	Introducing new tracks and different visuals and locations3.	Car customization and upgrades 4.	Depth in the driving mechanicsAll those points I mentioned this game lacks. This open world is just so boring to drive around, it just feels so lifeless, uneventful and bland visually. This open world is no need for speed underground 2 that’s for sure. I know it sounds like I am a NFS fan boy but it is honestly the best comparison I can make because this is the only burnout game that tried to pull off an open world like underground 2 did from underground 1. They should have honestly just stuck with what worked like burnout 3. There are also just so many small issues with the game that all build up together making the experience less enjoyable like the overall navigation and the overall time it takes to travel between each event. I was so bored after just 3 hours I couldn’t play it anymore. I have played so many better racing games throughout my life, this game is worse than even the average racing game. 4/10 (Mediocre)

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												The game itself is amazing and awesome, and there are still some lobbies out there for multiplayer on PC which is nice, however, I do wish all the DLC was ported, or at least big surf island. There are 3 classes of cars which each have their own important role in the game. There are a good amount of cars to collect along with a lot of paint options for each car. This game is also probably the most action packed racer I've played too due to how cars always smash each other up in the brunt of traffic and just trying to do a standard race normally can get a little intense (dare I say?). The awesome part about the open world is that there are literally hundreds of hidden ways you can go throughout the map along with tons of hidden things to find. So, on PC, I rate this a 8/10. If they ported all the DLC and included it, it would be a 9/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												Mastering the art of crashing in spectacular fashion, Burnout is back, with Paradise. In Paradise city (where the girls are pretty) players will encounter many things including the classics such as races and road rages through to the newer features like open-world stunt, speed and strength attributes for each car oh and did I mention it has a massive Guns 'n' Roses presence? It's got a MASSIVE Guns 'n' Roses presence (like the game title massive). Ontop of all this we have multiplayer which is essentially a sandbox for you and your friends to race, rage, stunt and crash in awesome fashion, also includes the chance to witness half naked dudes smiling in front of fans in their webcam reaction image (see "This Guy" Image). Though the crashes are epic, somehow Burnout 3's are still ..just better. Despite this Paradise is indeed where the cars (girls) are pretty...until you crash them of course. 8/10.

												8.5/10 Fantastic racing game, very open and gives you the option to do what you want while keeping you immersed in the game. You drive your car around picking races depending on their location on the map earning your self new licenses depending on how many races you win. Handling is fantastic as well as the boost and “takedowns”. Environment is very fluid, races are very well placed and you will start to get to know all the shortcuts in no time. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Burnout Paradise is the story of a city terrorized by a car driving poultergeist. The city desperately tries to function as it forces other drivers and one insane radio host to engage the maddened spirit in a series of races and stunt competitions in an attempt to distract it from wholesale destruction and crash cams. The government has abandoned the city in hopes of containing the menace, shutting down air travel and train travel, which just provides the poultergeist with more space to crash cars. The spirit is only embodied in human form when on a motorcycle, but that form disappears the second the motorcycle crashes.You are that poultergeist. Terrify a city as you possess different shiny cars. Reward their attempts to appease you by engaging in their races or laugh in their faces and crash in the most creative ways possible, forcing them to give you free gas, car repairs, and paint jobs. Or just drive really fast, scaring the poor people of this embattled city to death with the reckless abandon of your wild, wild poultergeist joy.*DISCLAIMER* This game is not actually about a poultergeist. It's just a fun driving game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												While the grass is sparce and the girls non-existent, Paradise offers a fast, fun, and satisfying experience to both newcomers and veterans to the Burnout series. The mechanics are easy to pick up, the city is filled with ramps, billboards, and gates to smash through, and the races are plentiful. The game looks beautiful, runs well, and has a great selection of radio tracks. The plethora of cars and bikes keep you coming back for more, and the online multiplayer provides an endless amount of entertainment. Sadly, Crash mode from the previous Burnout games has been removed. If you liked the linear, unique tracks of the previous games, the open-world aspect of Paradise will be a bit of a change. Cars are now divided into 3 classes: Stunt, Aggression, and Speed, each class has its own way of filling the boost meter. I've logged more hours in this game than I can count on the console version, and I plan to log many more on the PC. If you are a racing game fan, a Burnout fan, or even just a gamer, Burnout Paradise is worth your money.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												A reasonable 'unofficial end' to the burnout series, but far from the best. Having grown up on the console versions from the original through to revenge, I was actually disappointed by a few things, most notably the 'removal' of crashes as a core-component (as in, they're in there, but they're not essential to progress). Sometimes I found the new open world feature a little annoying. I want to go straight to an event - but no, instead I have to muck around driving to it, only to realise I don't have the right sort of car, so I have to spend ages driving back to somewhere I can swap a car just to go back and compete. Although, it was something new and it made things kind of fun. It even made you want to 'line up' your challenges, so that the end of one race was close to the start of another....I found it a bit unfulfilling, a lot of the unlocks came too easy and made little sense... I feel as though it's a bit of a victim of instant gratification-esque achievements in an attempt to try and woo gamers with short attention span that only enjoy frequent accomplishments rather than gamers that prefer a real challenge. Also I can now never listen to that stupid Guns 'n' Roses song ever again.... avoid if you like, and/or want to continue liking Guns 'n' Roses.

												If you're looking for something that offers a quick blast that is an alternative to other racing out there, there's this.Yes there is a silly and loose story attached, the absolute sin of unskippable cutscenes and the music selection tries to cater to everyone (look for the Jobcentre "on hold" music, I'll let you find it and not spoil it :P ) and - like any "best of" compilation, only one or two songs will stand out.Ultimately, it is arcade racing fun that doesn't require anything more than a keyboard and multiplayer races won't ever be filled with the snobs that will play Race '07 and the like.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												This game is a bit old now, but it's still one of the finest open-world racing games I've played.Pros:* Great soundtrack* Great visuals for its age.* Lots of that traditional "burnout" recklessness and fun.* Open World, with races and events being started at certain locations.* Large variety of events, from races to stunt runs.* I haven't tired a wheel with it, but it's got great controller support.Cons:* Some of the events can become repetitive as you try and unlock stuff.* AI isn't perfect.Overall, tons of fun. Definitely worth it if you can grab it in a sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 4, 2013
												[Singleplayer]This game brought me into glory days of Carmageddon 2 just because of adrenalin that goes trough your body when u first enter the race. Crashes are beatiful,races are intense, various numbers of cars,bikes and 4x4 jeeps. I would recommend this game to anyone who loves racing and even to those who dont because the game is simply amazing. Also u obtain cars in the most interesting way which im not going to spoil you gotta check it out for yourself.*Flaws*- Although there is various number of cars in burnout paradise there is just something that is lacking so    much, and that is car customization, although you get stock paintings and vinyls i really wanted to  immerse myself even more into this game by customazing my own car.- After lets say 5 hours of gameplay races tend to become more and more repetitive but that didnt stop me from enjoying the game.[Multiplayer]Multiplayer is really awesome u have included VOICE CHAT!!! I was like omg when i first entered online racing because there were so many people screaming and laughing it was just awesome. This type of behaviour really gives you sense that the game is really fun and i enjoyed it as much as everyone else in multiplayer.FINAL VERDICT= 10/10 (even with some major flaws i havent had that much fun since Flatout: Ultimate Carnage and Carmageddon)

												As a long time fan of the series, I have always wanted this game since it came out. Great graphics. Phenominal. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
												Burnout Paradise is, in short, a feel good game. Criterion Games deliver a relxing, yet boundless experience that can keep one entertained on occasion. The sandboxy, open-world that you are. right from the start, free to roam around in, creates a likening to that of Rockstars Grand Theft Auto. I have seen that some have experienced severe technical difficulties with the game. I, however, have not had a single issue.The game does become a little 'samey' after driving around the map multiple times, Great music though.7/10.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
												This is one of my favourite games! I would highly recommend this game to anyone that likes a racing game. Its open world so you drive to find races (which are absolutly everywhere). This games provides many hours of online and offline gaming. Once youve completed the car side of things there is then motorbike races to compete in. The graphics are very good for the age of the game, there is a great feeling of speed. The range of cars is impressive, I think around 70 in totals the range of bikes is a lot more limited.If you like any of the burnouts this will not dissapoint!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
												Picked this up to play with some friends and gave it a go solo while waiting for a game night to be arranged, not something I would have usualy baught but actualy glad I did, its a good little racer with open world mechanics and very nice graphics.The Ultimate box comes with a bike pack and some additional cars which is handy, the Bikes offer a slightly varied play style and a new set of races (though as a downside these are all solo, no A.I. involved)All in all , a worthwhile buy, good to play with friends (or online with randoms if you fancy it) and if your bored and dont know what to play, stick on some burnout.The only downside for me is that none of the races are actualy that hard, more of a "strained" cruise than a hard fought race.

												Burnout Paradise is a arcade racing game. To "finish" this game you need unlock a burnout driving license, but this game you can`t finish, there is so many things to do when you get this license. This game is fun and anybody who like this type of games i recommend to try and play. 8/10 +: -you can drive on all town-still nice graphic -Many cars to unlock -Many race type to play (classic race, takedown, escape race and acrobatic)-Music is to cool in this game (rock, pop, classic and more !) -very fast, aggressive and enjoyable gameplay-in game are motorbikes i like it :)-many billbords and offroad to find- AI is so aggressive, you must be faster then them or you gonna be takedown very quickly.-: -Only 4 motorbikes to unlock :( -No motorbike racing, only time run  -repetitive racing  -small town -poor cars modification -you can unlock new version of cars but they have no difference.

Posted: April 27, 2014
												A great game if you and a bunch of mates have some time to burn, multiplayer challenges are great fun, you and your mates are there on the spot if one of you either, produces some epic fails at a particular challenge, or produces an unbelievable stunt.  Burnout Paradise makes for some great gaming, especially with a party of 8 players, a great social game.There are plenty of cars, unlockable through your hard work of course.  There are plenty of challenges for as little as two players all the way through to an 8 player party, so grab your mates and get some challenges done.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												I'll start by saying that I don't really play racing games. The last racing game I've played was Burnout Revenge on PS2 and that was years ago. Before that, it was the GT3 on PS2. When the Origin bundle came out, I had heard about this but I wasn't really interested in it because I had heard it was very different from the older Burnout games. Well, it is, but I still managed to have fun with it. It's not without its flaws, though: the loading times are slow, unlocking every car takes so long and some of the game modes are absolutely boring. However, it's one of the racing games that actually made me want to play it for 30 hours. For me, that's good enough already.

												This game is great.  It's fun to unwind after a long day, just driving around the town.  There's also plenty of cars and different modes (race, stunts, etc) so that you don't feel like you're always doing the same thing over and over again.The only downside I would say is that you can't restart a race through the menu.  That's cool at first, but pretty aggravating when you just want to do a single race and fail.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												I work as a hostess at a restaurant and the other day, I was having a really crappy day. This girl and her boyfriend (maybe in their 20s) come in, with two 10yr olds in tow. Maybe they were baby sitting, or were watching younger sibling, I don't know. But the two younger boys were yelling, beating each other up, and whipping each other with those cheesy, battery-operated Christmas light necklaces.So we do the typical "Hi, welcome to _____!" and the girl asks for two kids menus. One of the little ♥♥♥♥♥ kids screams "And two giiiiirl menus!" while glaring at the girl and boyfriend. Something in me snapped. I turned to the kid and said, "That's great because I really like your necklace, you little ♥♥♥♥♥."The boyfriend laughed.
